description: Primes p = p(k) such that k * p - 1 is also a prime.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
example: 19 is the 8th prime and 8*19-1 = 151 is a prime.
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,200, if(isprime(n*prime(n)-1),print(prime(n))))(PARI) { n=k=0; forprime (p=2, 5*10^5, k++; if (isprime(k*p - 1), write("b062291.txt", n++, " ", p); if (n==1000, break)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 04 2009]
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 02 2001
extensions: More terms from _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 05 2001
